conclusion: Consider the forces acting on the small ball and the light rod when it passes through the highest point P.
The forces include the gravitational force, the centripetal force, and the frictional force between the small ball and the light rod.
Gravitational force acting on the small ball is F_g = mg = 10 N.
Centripetal force acting on the small ball is F_c = mv^2/L = 16 N.
Frictional force between the small ball and the light rod is F_f = μN.
Normal force is N = mg = 10 N.
Frictional force is F_f = μN = 5μ N.
Net force acting on the small ball is F_net = F_g + F_c + F_f = 10 + 16 + 5μ.
Direction of the net force is towards the center of the circle, which is the highest point P.
Direction of the force is θ = tan^(-1)(v/L) = tan^(-1)(8).
Magnitude of the net force is F_net = 26 + 5μ.
Force exerted by the small ball on the light rod is the net force acting on the small ball, F_net = 26 + 5μ.
Magnitude of the force exerted by the small ball on the light rod when it passes through the highest point P is 26 + 5μ N, and the direction is θ = tan^(-1)(4/0.5).
